name: Dog Breeds in the Herding Group Quiz | Animals | 10 Questions

questions.text: This German breed is also known as an Alsatian. Much used in police and guide-dog work, it is well-known worldwide.
questions.explanation:
German Shepherd Dog.

	The GSD is hardly ever used to herd; it is usually thought of as a protection or sport dog.

questions.text: This large white Hungarian dog has a 'corded' coat, resembling dreadlocks.
questions.explanation:
Komondor.

	The Puli is also a corded Hungarian dog, but is smaller and often has a color other than white.

questions.text: Widely acclaimed as the 'most intelligent breed', this herding dog originated in Great Britain. Although usually black and white, it can be several other colors, such as red and white, tri and blue merle.
questions.explanation:
Border Collie.

	Border Collies are too much dog for most people- they need a job!

questions.text: This short-legged Welsh herding breed has a tail and is often merle in color.
questions.explanation:
Cardigan Welsh Corgi.

	The Pembroke does not have a tail and is not merle.

questions.text: Which of the Belgian herding breeds has a short coat?
questions.explanation:
Belgian Malinois.

	The Shepherd is black and long-haired, the Tervuren is colored much like a Malinois but with long hair.

questions.text: What is a short-coated Collie called?
questions.explanation:
Smooth Collie.

	The smooth Collie is the same breed as the 'Lassie-type' Rough Collie, but has a short coat.

questions.text: This boisterous breed resembles a small Old English Sheepdog but has a tail. It is usually grey and white but can be other colors such as blue and white and fawn and white.
questions.explanation:
Bearded Collie.

	Beardies are often seen in agility competitions- they are lively dogs and good jumpers.

questions.text: The Shetland sheepdog (sheltie) is the lightest dog in the Herding Group?
questions.explanation:
True.

	This breed was originally developed to herd miniature sheep! The Pembroke and Cardigan corgis are heavier than the Shetland sheepdog, but both are heavier.

questions.text: This dog is native to Israel. It is a versatile breed, hunting and guarding as well as herding.
questions.explanation:
Canaan Dog.

	It is the most primitive-looking of the herding breeds, with a short coat and curled tail.

questions.text: This large, long-coated breed was developed for driving cattle.
questions.explanation:
Bouvier des Flandres.

	This is the classic "Dog of Flanders."
